definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: I commanded the voice before terror could incapacitate me.
sentences.chinese: 我趕在恐懼擊倒我以前對那個聲音下令。

sentences.english: He downed his opponent with three blows.
He leaves with a record of 39-6 with 30 knockouts .
sentences.chinese: 他留下了創記錄的39勝6敗，30次擊倒對手。

sentences.english: If it is your time, love will track you down like a cruise missile.
sentences.chinese: 如果是您的時間，愛將跟蹤您擊倒象尋呼臺”。

sentences.english: With Victor’s guard down, Jack knocks him to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 由於維克多的戒心鬆懈，傑克將他擊倒在地。

sentences.english: When you play bowls, the object is to knock down as many of the ten wooden pins as possible.
sentences.chinese: 玩滾木球遊戲時，目標是儘量多地擊倒十個木瓶。

sentences.english: The champion dropped the challenger in the fourth round.
sentences.chinese: 這位冠軍在第四回合把挑戰者擊倒在地。

sentences.english: MaXiao sudden between his handgun will blade down.
sentences.chinese: 馬嘯陡然間拔出手槍將刀鋒擊倒。

sentences.english: The challenger is kayo in the first round. (also k. o. )
sentences.chinese: 挑戰者在第一個回合，就被擊倒在地上。

sentences.english: The wood cross can be knock-down, it is convenience to cleaning the window.
sentences.chinese: 木材交叉可擊倒，這是方便清潔的窗口。

sentences.english: He downed his opponent with a quick right to the jaw.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速準確擊中對手的下頜而把他擊倒。

sentences.english: At the cost of bowling over one young fellow I got through.
sentences.chinese: 我一拳擊倒了一個小夥子，這才通了過去。

sentences.english: Thou strik'st the dull peasant-he sinks in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你擊倒了平庸的農民，他沉淪於黑夜。

sentences.english: The boxer KOed five in a row.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊手一連擊倒了五個對手。
謠言蠻語不能把你擊倒。

sentences.english: Cui flower feel master out of the cold, our Ye think that it is a technical defeat.
sentences.chinese: 翠花覺得師傅出陰招，雋燁認爲那只是技術性擊倒。

definition: to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
